newsitem.title: FINLAND: Cautious Helsinki ends up with metals leading rise.
newsitem.headline: Cautious Helsinki ends up with metals leading rise.

text.p: Finnish shares broke a three-day losing streak and ended cautiously higher on Wednesday with metal and engineering companies' shares in the lead cheered by firmer Wall Street metal industry stocks overnight.
The Helsinki bourse HEX all-share index closed 4.2 points or 0.2 percent higher at 2,104.36 points. Turnover was a quiet 204 million markka.
Telecoms blue-chip Nokia shed 0.70 markka to 185.80 markka accounting for almost one third of trade.
In the metal and engineering sector, Rauma advanced 2.80 markka to 97.00 markka.
Brokers said the sentiment was cautious with investors nervously awaiting U.S. August payrolls and jobless data due for release on Friday.
"The market is still nervous due to recent volatility in U.S. interest rates," one broker said.
